JPN: #6 レナと魅音のお見舞い

TextJPN: 横になってどのくらいたっただろう。
TextENG: I wonder how much time had passed since I laid down.

TextJPN: 外は暗くなりかけていた。
TextENG: It was getting dark outside.

TextJPN: 体は汗でぐっしょりだった。@k……ちゃんと寝巻きに着替えた方がいいかもしれない。
TextENG: My body was soaked in sweat.@k ...It would probably be a good idea to change my sheets.

TextJPN: その時、階下の電話が鳴った。
TextENG: At that moment, the phone downstairs rang.

TextJPN: 多分、お袋じゃないだろうか。
TextENG: It was probably Mom.

TextJPN: お袋は結構心配性だからな。@k……ひょっとすると気付かなかっただけで、もう何度目かの電話かもしれない…。
TextENG: Mom was quite the worrywart.@k ...Maybe she had called many times but I just didn't notice it...

TextJPN: 「もしもし前原ですけど」
TextENG: ``Hello, this is the Maebara residence.``
``Oh, he's alive! Hello!@k@vS01/03/120300083. This is Mion.@k@vS01/03/120300084. How you doing~?``

TextJPN: 「ん、圭一のお友達ですか？@k@vS01/01/120100321.　圭一は休んでますけど。@k@vS01/01/120100322.代わりましょうか？」
TextENG: ``Hm, is this one of Keiichi's friends?@k@vS01/01/120100321. Keiichi is resting now, but...@k@vS01/01/120100322. shall I put him on?``
``Huh!?@k@vS01/03/120300086. I-I-Is this his dad??@k@vS01/03/120300087. Ahahahaha, s-s-sorry!!``
``Bwahahahahahahahaha!!@k@vS01/01/120100324. Idiot~!@k@vS01/01/120100325. You fell for it!``

TextJPN: 「え？！@k@vS01/03/120300089.　け、圭ちゃぁああぁあぁああぁん！！」
TextENG: ``Huh!?@k@vS01/03/120300089. K-Kei-chaaaaAAAaaaaaAAan!!``

TextJPN: いつものノリの応酬に、互いにしばし笑い合った。
TextENG: After our exchange, we both had a good laugh together.

TextJPN: ……だが、笑い合いながら、疑ってしまう…。
TextENG: ...Except I was suspicious of her even as we were laughing...

TextJPN: ……みんなは…本当に事件と関係あるんだろうか…？
TextENG: ...Was everybody... really involved in the incidents...?

TextJPN: ……ない、とそう言い切れない自分が悲しかった。
TextENG: ...The fact that I couldn't say ``no,`` saddened me.

TextJPN: 「元気そうで安心したよ。@k@vS01/03/120300091.レナもすごく心配してたよ？@k@vS01/03/120300092.　沙都子はざまぁないですわって喜んでたな。@k@vS01/03/120300093.梨花ちゃんは病気でかわいそかわいそです、ってさ！」
TextENG: ``I'm relieved that you seem well.@k@vS01/03/120300091. Rena was really worried, you know?@k@vS01/03/120300092. Satoko-chan was happy and said you got what you deserved!@k@vS01/03/120300093. Rika-chan said, 'how unfortunate he's sick!'``

TextJPN: 「ちぇ、みんなで勝手に大盛り上がりしてたみたいだなぁ！」
TextENG: ``Heh, looks like everyone was making a big deal out of it!``

TextJPN: 「まぁまぁ。でさ圭ちゃん。@k@vS01/03/120300095.お見舞いに行っちゃ都合悪いかな？」
TextENG: ``Well, you know. So Kei-chan...@k@vS01/03/120300095. Is now a bad time to come pay you a visit?``

TextJPN: 「お見舞い？@k@vS01/01/120100328.　いいよ、そんな。重病人ってわけじゃないんだから」
TextENG: ``A visit?@k@vS01/01/120100328. No, it's okay. It's not like I'm dying.``

TextJPN: 「うちの婆っちゃが山ほどおはぎを作ってさ。@k@vS01/03/120300097.お裾分けに持ってけって言ってんだよ。@k@vS01/03/120300098.だから持ってくね！」
TextENG: ``My grandma made a ton of mochi, you see.@k@vS01/03/120300097. I was told to share them.@k@vS01/03/120300098. So I'll bring you some!``

TextJPN: 「…おいおい、風邪がうつっても知らねぇぞ」
TextENG: ``...Hey now, you'll catch my cold.``

TextJPN: 「おじさんもレナもおバカさんだから大丈夫！@k@vS01/03/120300100.　じゃね！@k@vS01/03/120300101.　すぐ行くから！」
TextENG: ``Not to worry! Both Rena and I are too stupid to catch a cold!@k@vS01/03/120300100. See you!@k@vS01/03/120300101. Be there in a bit!``

TextJPN: 電話は威勢良く切れた。
TextENG: She hung up cheerfully.

TextJPN: レナも来るのか？
TextENG: Rena's coming too?

TextJPN: そんな言い方だったな。
TextENG: That's what it sounded like.

TextJPN: ……レナに会うのはまだちょっと気になったが、魅音と一緒ならと思った。
TextENG: ...I was still concerned about meeting Rena, but I guess if she was with Mion...

TextJPN: やがて、１０分もしない内に玄関のチャイムがなった。
TextENG: I heard the doorbell ten minutes later.

TextJPN: 「どんなカンジ？@k@vS01/03/120300103.　ちゃんと薬飲んで寝てた～？」
TextENG: ``How are you feeling?@k@vS01/03/120300103. Did you take your medicine and rest~?``

TextJPN: 「そりゃもうしっかりとな」
TextENG: ``I did just that.``

TextJPN: 「げ、元気そうで良かった。心配してたんだよ…」
TextENG: ``Th-Thank goodness you look well. I was worried...``

TextJPN: 「悪かったな。…明日にはもう大丈夫だよ」
TextENG: ``Sorry... I'll be fine by tomorrow.``

TextJPN: 全然病み上がりを気遣わない魅音と、心の底から心配そうな顔をしているレナ。
TextENG: Mion showed a complete lack of concern for someone who's recovering, and Rena looked like she was worried about me from the bottom of her heart.

TextJPN: ……その表情に裏はないように見えた。
TextENG: ...It didn't look like there was anything behind those expressions.

TextJPN: 「……ちょっとお邪魔しようかと思ったけど、まだ本調子じゃないみたいだねぇ」
TextENG: ``...I thought we might hang out for a bit, but it looks like you're not quite in the condition for it.``

TextJPN: 「ん、そ、そうか？！」
TextENG: ``Hm? Y-You don't say!?``

TextJPN: 俺の表情が陰るのを見られたようだった。
TextENG: It seemed my face appeared a bit sullen.

TextJPN: 「…じゃこれ、圭一くん。@k@vS01/02/120200146.…魅ぃちゃんのおばあちゃんが作ってくれたおはぎだよ」
TextENG: ``...Then here, Keiichi-kun.@k@vS01/02/120200146. ...These are the mochi Mii-chan's grandma made.``

TextJPN: レナが新聞紙で包んだそれを差し出す。
TextENG: Rena held out the package wrapped in newspaper.

TextJPN: ５つくらいは入っているのかもしれない。
TextENG: There might be about five in here.

TextJPN: …ずっしりとした重さがある。
TextENG: ...It was quite hefty.

TextJPN: 「あ、サンキューな。…魅音のばあちゃんによろしく伝えといてくれよ」
TextENG: ``Ah, thanks. Send my regards to your grandma, Mion.``

TextJPN: 「うん。@k@vS01/02/120200148.あ、その中にね、レナが作ったのも混じってるんだよ！@k@vS01/02/120200149.　圭一くんに見つけられるかなぁ…」
TextENG: ``Yep.@k@vS01/02/120200148. Ah, there's one that I made in there as well!@k@vS01/02/120200149. I wonder if Keiichi-kun can guess which one...``

TextJPN: 「これ、今日の部活を欠席した圭ちゃんへの宿題ね！@k@vS01/03/120300106.　おはぎにアルファベットがついてるから明日回答すること！」
TextENG: ``This is Kei-chan's homework since he missed the club meeting today!@k@vS01/03/120300106. There are letters on each mochi, so I'll ask you tomorrow!``

TextJPN: 「お、お見舞いなのか部活なのかどっちかにしろーッ！！！」
TextENG: ``W-Were you checking if I was feeling better or did you just come here for club activities!?!``

TextJPN: 「うんうん、元気元気。これなら明日は大丈夫そうだね～」
TextENG: ``Yep, yep, looking fine. Guess you'll be able to make it tomorrow~.``

TextJPN: 「この騒ぎで熱がぶり返したらどうしてくれんだよ、まったく」
TextENG: ``Man, what are you going to do if my fever comes back because of your shenanigans?``

TextJPN: 「み、魅ぃちゃん、あんまり騒いじゃ悪いよ…。@k@vS01/02/120200151.もう行こ。@k@vS01/02/120200152.おうちの人にも怒られるよ」
TextENG: ``M-Mii-chan, we shouldn't be making such a racket...@k@vS01/02/120200151. Let's go.@k@vS01/02/120200152. The other people here will get angry.``

TextJPN: …二人は両親がいると思っているらしかった。
TextENG: ...Both of them thought my parents were home.

TextJPN: うちの玄関は乱雑だからな。
TextENG: It was because the entranceway was a mess.

TextJPN: 「そうだね、もう行こっかね。@k@vS01/03/120300109.………あ、そうそう圭ちゃん」
TextENG: ``You're right, let's get going.@k@vS01/03/120300109. ...Ah, by the way, Kei-chan.``

TextJPN: 「なんだよ」
TextENG: ``Yeah?``

TextJPN: 「お昼、何食べた？」
TextENG: ``What did you eat for lunch?``

TextJPN: ぴくっと反応し、魅音を見上げてぎょっとした。
TextENG: The sudden question startled me and I went wide-eyed when I saw Mion.

TextJPN: ……これまでに見た事のない、…薄気味悪い顔だったからだ。
TextENG: ...I had never seen her like that... it was a highly unsettling visage.

TextJPN: しかし…なぜ…俺に今日のお昼の話を聞く……？
TextENG: But... why... is she asking me about what I ate for lunch...?

TextJPN: 魅音の言葉は無気味なくらい空虚だった。
TextENG: What she said was so inane it was almost meaningless.

TextJPN: …俺が何を食べたかなんて初めから興味ないような、そんな言い方だったからだ。
TextENG: ...The way she said it, it was almost like she didn't even care at all about what I ate.

TextJPN: 「お、表で食べたよ…」
TextENG: ``I-I ate out...``

TextJPN: ……大石さんと一緒だったことを勘繰られているんだろうか……。
TextENG: ...She must have suspected that I was with Ooishi-san...

TextJPN: とにかくはぐらかせても、躊躇しても深読みされると思い…俺はなるべく早く返事を返したつもりだった。
TextENG: Anyway, I felt that if I hesitated or tried to change the subject then they'd read too deep into it... so I tried answering as quickly as possible.

TextJPN: だが……俺のそんな努力とは裏腹に、二人の返事には間があった。
TextENG: Except... contrary to the efforts I had made... there was a pause before they replied.

TextJPN: 「…ふ～ん、圭一くん、お昼は外食だったんだね」
TextENG: ``...Hmm, so you ate out for lunch, Keiichi-kun.``

TextJPN: レナもいつの間にか瞳の輝きを変えていた。
TextENG: The glimmer from Rena's eyes had changed at some point, as well.

TextJPN: ……それはギラギラとして、…一層、言葉に白々しさを感じさせた。
TextENG: ...It was now sharp... as if to make me feel the feigned ignorance behind her words even more.

TextJPN: ………自身はすでに知っていながら、無知を装っている…そうにしか見えなかった。
TextENG: ...As if she already knew... that's how it looked to me.

TextJPN: 「どう？　おいしかった？」
TextENG: ``Well? Was it good?``

TextJPN: 「…な、なんでそんな事を聞くんだよ……」
TextENG: ``...Wh-Why are you asking me this...?``

TextJPN: 魅音のオクターブは変に低かった。
TextENG: Mion was speaking in an unusually low tone.

TextJPN: …まるでそれは……俺が…町のレストランで食事したことを…知っているかのような……。
TextENG: ...Almost as if... she knew that I had eaten at the restaurant in town...

TextJPN: いや……考え過ぎだ。
TextENG: No... I'm overthinking this.

TextJPN: …だって…お昼の時間には２人とも学校にいたはずなんだ。
TextENG: ...I mean... both of them should have been in school at lunchtime.

TextJPN: ……俺の所在を知るはずはない……。
TextENG: ...There was no way they could have known where I was...

TextJPN: 「渋いおじさまとご一緒だったみたいだけど、……誰？」
TextENG: ``Seems you were with a rather austere-looking older guy. ...Who was he?``

TextJPN: どさり。
TextENG: Flop.

TextJPN: …俺の手からおはぎの包みが滑り落ちる。
TextENG: The package with the mochi I was holding slipped out of my hands.

TextJPN: 自分の顔から血の気が、音を立てながら引いて行くのがわかった。
TextENG: I could tell the blood had drained from my face, making me go pale.
``...Oh?@k@vS01/02/120200155. Keiichi-kun, who was he?@k@vS01/02/120200156. ...Could it be the person from before, I wonder?@k@vS01/02/120200157. ...I wonder!?``

TextJPN: 舌の根までカラカラに乾いていく…。
TextENG: I could feel the back of my throat going dry...

TextJPN: もはや……はったりですらない。
TextENG: This was no longer a bluff.

TextJPN: ……こいつらは……全て知っているのだ……？！
TextENG: ...They... knew everything...!?

TextJPN: 「な、………なんで………そんな事……わかるんだよ……？」
TextENG: ``H... How... do you... know that...?``

TextJPN: やっと、それだけを喉から搾り出すのが精一杯だった。
TextENG: It took everything I had to finally force those words from my throat.

TextJPN: …膝がかくん、かくんと鳴り出す。
TextENG: ...My knees were shaking.

TextJPN: 「………さぁてね。@k@vS01/03/120300114.…おじさんにわからないことはないからね」
TextENG: ``...Because...@k@vS01/03/120300114. ...there's nothing this old man doesn't know.``

TextJPN: …魅音は意味深ににやりと、…糸を引くように笑った。
TextENG: ...Mion sneered knowingly... and her laugh seemed to carry on forever.

TextJPN: 「で、圭ちゃん、何のお話をしてたの？@k@vS01/03/120300116.　ずいぶんと熱くなってたみたいだけど…？」
TextENG: ``So, Kei-chan, what did you talk about?@k@vS01/03/120300116. It seems like you got pretty worked up over it, too...``

TextJPN: 「み、みんなの話はしてないよ…！@k@vS01/01/120100341.　魅音ともレナとも関係ない…！」
TextENG: ``W-We weren't talking about you guys...!@k@vS01/01/120100341. It didn't have anything to do with you or Rena...!``

TextJPN: 「ふぅん？@k@vS01/02/120200159.　…聞いてもないのにレナたちの名前が出るなんて、なんだか怪しいなぁ？」
TextENG: ``Hmm?@k@vS01/02/120200159. ...Isn't it a bit strange to hear our names come up even though nobody asked about that, hmmm?``

TextJPN: レナはねっとりとした目線で、俺の瞳のさらに奥をうかがっていた。
TextENG: Rena's unwavering gaze pierced through my eyes and peered further inside me.

TextJPN: 墓穴だ。@k……心臓の鼓動が爆発しそうなくらい大きくなる……。
TextENG: I'd dug my own grave.@k ...My heart was throbbing so much, it felt like it was going to explode...

TextJPN: 「ま、何を隠れてやろうとも、おじさんには全てお見通しってこと。@k@vS01/03/120300118.…それだけを忘れないでくれればいいかなぁ」
TextENG: ``Well, whatever you're trying to hide... This old man already sees through it all.@k@vS01/03/120300118. Remember that.``

TextJPN: 頭を振ることもできない。
TextENG: I couldn't even shake my head.

TextJPN: …奥歯ががちがち鳴りそうになるのを必死に押しとどめるのが精一杯だ…。
TextENG: ...It took everything I had to stop my teeth from chattering...

TextJPN: 魅音は小首を優雅に傾げるような仕草をしながらも、決して俺の目をその眼差しから解放しようとはしなかった。
TextENG: She never let her gaze break from mine, even as she tilted her head slightly.

TextJPN: 「…圭一くん、顔色悪いよ？@k@vS01/02/120200161.　もう横になった方がいいと思うな」
TextENG: ``...Keiichi-kun, you don't look so good.@k@vS01/02/120200161. I think you should lie down.``

TextJPN: 「そうだね。私たちはもう帰ろ」
TextENG: ``That's true. We should both head back home.``

TextJPN: 二人はまるで何事もなかったかのように笑い合い、玄関を後にしようとした。
TextENG: As if nothing had happened, they both giggled at each other and started making their way out.

TextJPN: 俺はさっき、おはぎの包みを落とした格好のまま、指一本動かすこともできないでいる。
TextENG: I hadn't moved a muscle since I had dropped the package of mochi.

TextJPN: 二人が扉を出、…その扉が…ゆっくりと閉じていく。
TextENG: As they left, the door slowly closed behind them.

TextJPN: ……俺はそれをじっと見ているしかない。@k…まるで、扉が閉まりきるまで動いてはいけないかのように。
TextENG: ...All I could do was stare.@k ...As if I couldn't move until the door was completely closed.

TextJPN: その閉じかけた扉が『ぐいっ！』と開けられ、俺の心臓がもう一度跳ね上がった。
TextENG: Just as the door was just about closed, it opened again slightly with a sudden creak, sending my heart racing once again.

TextJPN: 扉の隙間から片目だけを覗かせて、再び魅音の鷹の目が俺を貫いた。
TextENG: A single eye peered in through that narrow slit, and Mion's hawkish gaze peered at me once again.

TextJPN: 「じゃあね圭ちゃん」
TextENG: ``See you, Kei-chan.``

TextJPN: 「………明日、学校休んじゃ“嫌だよ”？」
TextENG: ``...I'd 'hate it' if you missed school tomorrow, alright?``

TextJPN: ばたん。
TextENG: Thud.

TextJPN: ……扉が閉まった。
TextENG: ...The door closed.

TextJPN: 二人の低い笑い声が遠ざかり、静寂が戻ってきても、俺は指一本動かすことはできなかった……。
TextENG: I wasn't able to move a muscle even after their low laughter died off into the distance and silence once again enveloped the room...

TextJPN: 我にかえり、俺が最初にしたことは扉にカギをかけることだった…。
TextENG: Coming back to my senses, the first thing I did was lock the door...

TextJPN: 魅音たちは…俺が大石さんと話していたことを知っている…？！
TextENG: They knew what Ooishi-san and I talked about...!?

TextJPN: どうして…？！@k　どうやって？！
TextENG: Why...!?@k How!?

TextJPN: いや、…そんなことはどうでもよかった。…知られた、ということだけが事実なのだ。
TextENG: No... that wasn't important...

TextJPN: 今にして思えば……大石さんが俺を尋ねてきたその最初から…話は全て筒抜けだったのかもしれない。@k……魅音の言う通り…俺には何も隠し事などできはしないのだ…。
TextENG: Thinking about it now... All of it could have been overheard... from the beginning when Ooishi-san met me.@k ...Just as Mion said... I couldn't hide anything...

TextJPN: じゃあ……魅音たちは…俺に何が言いたいんだ…？
TextENG: Then... what were they... trying to tell me...?

TextJPN: …そんなのは決まってる。
TextENG: ...That part was obvious.

TextJPN: …俺に“余計な話”はするな、と釘を刺しているのだ。
TextENG: They were warning me not to say anything 'unnecessary.'

TextJPN: 余計な話って何だ…？
TextENG: What did they deem unnecessary...?

TextJPN: 俺が大石さんとしている話はひとつしかない。@k……そしてそれが余計だと警告しているのだ。
TextENG: I only talked with Ooishi-san about one thing.@k ...And they were warning me that that was unnecessary.

TextJPN: 大石さんが俺にしている話……それは毎年起こるオヤシロさまの祟りは個々の事件でなく、@k全て関連した事件であり、……しかもそれは複数犯で雛見沢に潜伏しているかもしれない……というものだ。
TextENG: What was it that Ooishi-san talked to me about...? The incidents involving Oyashiro-sama's curse that occurred every year weren't individual cases...@k but were connected as a whole... As well as the fact that there may be multiple perpetrators hidden within Hinamizawa...

TextJPN: いや…もっと踏み込んで言った。
TextENG: No... more precisely...

TextJPN: …魅音がレナが、沙都子が梨花ちゃんが怪しいと名指しで言ったのだ。
TextENG: ...that Mion, Rena, Satoko, and Rika-chan were all suspicious.

TextJPN: それに対しての警告だというなら……？
TextENG: Is that what they are warning me against...?

TextJPN: 「な……なに馬鹿なこと考えてんだよ……俺ッ！！」
TextENG: ``Wh... What kind of nonsense am I thinking about!?``

TextJPN: 『ぱしーん！』と大きな音が立つくらい大きく、自分の頬を打った。
TextENG: I hit my own face hard enough that it let out a loud slap.

TextJPN: ……それで悪い夢が覚めればと思ったが…なぜか布団を叩いたような手応えしかなく…虚しいくらい痛くない。
TextENG: ...If only that would wake me from this nightmare... But for some reason it felt like I was punching a blanket... it was almost laughably painless.

TextJPN: 冷静になれ前原圭一…！
TextENG: Calm down, Keiichi Maebara...!

TextJPN: 俺はいつからこんなネガティブなことしか考えない男になったんだ？！
TextENG: When did I become such a pessimist?

TextJPN: 冷静になれ冷静になれ！
TextENG: Calm down. Calm down!

TextJPN: 落ち着いてよく整理するんだ…！
TextENG: Settle down and sort things out...!

TextJPN: 魅音が、俺が大石さんと昼飯を食っていたのを知ってたのは………きっとあのお店に雛見沢の人がたまたま来ていたんだろう。
TextENG: The reason Mion knew I was eating lunch with Ooishi-san was probably because... somebody from Hinamizawa just happened to be there at the time.

TextJPN: それで魅音に俺が来ていたことを伝えたに違いない…。
TextENG: They must have told Mion that I was there...

TextJPN: そう思えば一番自然だ。
TextENG: That made the most sense.

TextJPN: それに…よくよく考えれば……魅音は俺がどこで昼飯を食ったかしか聞いてないぞ？
TextENG: Plus... come to think of it... She didn't ask me where I ate lunch, did she?

TextJPN: …それで『おいしかった？』って聞いただけだ…！
TextENG: ...She only asked, ``was it good?``...!

TextJPN: たまたま俺と同席が雛見沢の人間じゃなかったから興味を覚えられただけで……別に…他意なんかないのかもしれない…。@kそうだ、そうに違いない…！
TextENG: They were just curious since I was together with someone not from Hinamizawa... It's not... as if they had any ulterior motives...@k That's it. That has to be it...!

TextJPN: 今にして思えば、レナの時もそうだ。
TextENG: Thinking about it that way, it was the same with Rena.

TextJPN: 俺が大石さんに会ったことを変に濁したので、レナに正されただけなんだ。
TextENG: I was just being strangely ambiguous about when I met with Ooishi-san, and Rena was just correcting me on that.

TextJPN: それを俺が、いつものおっとりしたレナとのギャップに面食らってしまい……驚いてしまっただけなんだ…。@kそう考えるのが一番自然だ…！
TextENG: That's when I was bewildered by the change in character from the usual mild-mannered Rena... and was just startled by it...@k That's the most natural way of thinking about it...!

TextJPN: ……頭の中がぐちゃぐちゃのスパゲッティになったような気分だ。
TextENG: ...It felt like my mind was mixed up like a tangled mess of spaghetti.

TextJPN: …こうして頭をぎゅっと押さえていたなら、耳や鼻から真っ赤なミートソースがはみ出てくるかもしれない。
TextENG: ...Deep red marinara sauce would have poured out of my nose and ears if you squeezed my head.

TextJPN: そう思ったら、急に吐き気と頭痛を感じた。
TextENG: Thinking that, I suddenly felt like vomiting.

TextJPN: ……本当にそうなったらいやだったので、俺は頭を抱えるのをやめる…。
TextENG: ...I really didn't want that to happen, so I stopped holding my head...

TextJPN: 誰が何を言っているのか、最近、全然わからない…。
TextENG: Lately, I had no idea what anyone was saying...

TextJPN: みんなと一緒にいる時は楽しい。@k表裏なんか感じない。@kみんな…本当にいいヤツらだと思う…。
TextENG: Spending time with them was fun.@k It didn't feel like there was any sort of hidden agenda.@k I really do think that they're a good bunch of people...

TextJPN: 引越して来て、右も左もわからない俺に本当に親切にしてくれた。
TextENG: When I just moved here and couldn't make heads or tails of everything, they were really kind to me.

TextJPN: レナは本当に親切な、面倒見のいいヤツだ。@k変な病気さえ出さなければ本当に可愛いヤツなんだ。
TextENG: Rena was really kind and always looked after me.@k As long as that strange affliction didn't rear its ugly head, she was really pretty cute.

TextJPN: 魅音も最高にいいヤツ。@k歳や性別を気にせず、ポジティブでアクティブ。@kあいつと一緒だと退屈しない。
TextENG: Mion is also a really good person.@k She didn't care about anyone's age or gender, and was optimistic and outgoing.@k I was never bored when I was with her.

TextJPN: …退屈しないなら、賑やかな沙都子だっていいヤツだ。@kいろいろ生意気だが、それがあいつのコミュニケーションなんだよ。
TextENG: ...And talking of not getting bored, rambunctious Satoko was a good person for that, too.@k She was pretty bratty, but that was just the way she interacted with others.

TextJPN: …梨花ちゃんだってそうさ。@k口数は少ないけど、無口なんじゃない。…仲間さ！！
TextENG: ...Rika-chan was the same way.@k She didn't speak often, but that didn't mean she was always silent. ...They're my friends!

TextJPN: …だが…富竹さんや大石さんに、知らなくてもいい雛見沢の秘密を……オヤシロさまの祟りの話を聞かされた頃から……おかしくなり始めた。
TextENG: ...But... after hearing of the better untold secrets of Hinamizawa from Ooishi-san and Tomitake-san... when I was told about Oyashiro-sama's curse... things started going crazy.

TextJPN: そして大石さんから…みんなが、…魅音がレナが沙都子が梨花ちゃんが怪しいと聞かされた。
TextENG: Then hearing from Ooishi-san... that Mion, Rena, Satoko, and Rika-chan were all suspicious.

TextJPN: ……そして……みんなが変わってしまった。
TextENG: ...After that... everyone changed.

TextJPN: …そうだ。
TextENG: ...That's right.

TextJPN: 大石さんが変な話を始めてから、だんだんとおかしくなりだしたんだ…。
TextENG: It all started getting weird after Ooishi-san told me all that strange stuff...

TextJPN: ……やっぱりあの時……変な話なんかきっぱり聞かなければよかったんだ。
TextENG: ...At that time, I really should have... should have just not listened to those weird stories.

TextJPN: ……それならそもそもあの綿流しの晩、富竹さんに過去の事件の話を聞いたことからいけなかったんだろう…。
TextENG: ...I shouldn't even have asked Tomitake-san about the past incidents on the night of the Watanagashi...

TextJPN: ……俺が変な好奇心さえ出さなければ………出さなければ………。
TextENG: ...If I just hadn't gotten that strange sense of curiosity... if I just hadn't...

TextJPN: そうだ…。@kだからみんなは富竹さんを……。@kみんながせっかく俺のために隠してくれていることを、よそ者の分際で俺なんかにしゃべったから。
TextENG: That's right...@k So that's why they ****ed Tomitake-san.@k That impudent outsider speaking to the likes of me after everybody went out of their way to keep it a secret from me.

TextJPN: じゃあ、大石さんだって……？@k　みんながこんなにも知らないほうがいいと忠告してくれることを掘り返そうとしている。
TextENG: They'll probably **** Ooishi-san as well.@k For trying to unearth what everybody was warning me was better left buried.

TextJPN: それに…俺にみんなを疑わせるようなことを吹き込んだ許せない男だ。@k…あんなヤツなら、どうなっても知ったことか…！！！
TextENG: Besides that... he was unforgivable for spewing words that made me doubt the others.@k ...Of course a guy like that is going to be ****ed...!!!

TextJPN: 富竹さんも大石さんも所詮はよそ者なんだ。@k雛見沢の人間とは相容れない存在なんだよ。@kそんなヤツらこそオヤシロさまの祟りにあって＊されるべきなんだ！！
TextENG: Both Tomitake-san and Ooishi-san were nothing but outsiders, after all.@k They were entities who couldn't coexist with the people of Hinamizawa.@k Those guys should just fall to Oyashiro-sama's curse and just ***!!

TextJPN: みんなは悪くない。
TextENG: It wasn't their fault.

TextJPN: …悪いのは好奇心を抑えきれなかった俺の方なんだ。
TextENG: ...It was my fault for not being able to hold back my curiosity.

TextJPN: みんなは悪くない。
TextENG: It wasn't their fault.

TextJPN: みんなは悪くない。
TextENG: It wasn't their fault...

TextJPN: みんなは悪くないみんなは悪くないみんなは悪くない…。
TextENG: Itwasn'ttheirfaultitwasn'ttheirfaultitwasn'ttheirfault.

TextJPN: ぼーっとした…寝起きのような鈍い感覚だったが、さっきまであった嫌な悪寒は薄れていた。@k……もう大丈夫。@k…もう怖くない。@k…もう完全復活。
TextENG: I settled into a daze... it was a lethargic feeling like I had just gotten up, but the ominous chill that haunted me had subsided.@k ...I was fine now.@k ...I was no longer frightened.@k ...I had completely recovered.

TextJPN: 明日は元気に学校行こう。@kみんなに挨拶。@k部活もやろう。@kきっと楽しい。@k絶対楽しい。
TextENG: I'll go to school tomorrow, right as rain.@k I'll greet everyone.@k I'll take part in club activities.@k It'll definitely be fun.@k It had to be fun.

TextJPN: ……俺はみんなの仲間なんだから。
TextENG: ...I was one of them, after all.

TextJPN: 「……あ、そうだ。おはぎ食べないと…。@k@vS01/01/120100346.どれがレナの手作りか、当てないといけないんだよな」
TextENG: ``...Ah, that reminds me. I need to eat those mochi...@k@vS01/01/120100346. I hope I'm able to tell which one Rena made.``

TextJPN: さっき二人が持ってきたお見舞いの宿題を思い出す。
TextENG: I remembered the homework the two brought with them when they visited me.

TextJPN: しかし、部活練習がデリバリーされるなんて、うちの部ってすごいよな。
TextENG: But wow, our club did delivery. That was something else.

TextJPN: 床に落ちたままになっていたおはぎの包みを拾い上げ、居間へ持って行った。
TextENG: I picked up the package I'd dropped on the floor and headed into the living room.

TextJPN: せっかくだからお茶を飲みながらの方がいいかもしれない。
TextENG: It would be nice, I guess, to have some tea with it.

TextJPN: …お茶を飲みながら頬張る手作りおはぎ。@k……お。@k結構うまそうなシチュエーションだぞ。
TextENG: ...To fill my mouth with mochi while drinking tea.@k ...Oh.@k This was quite a delectable situation I was in.

TextJPN: 新聞紙の包装を開くと、中にはこじんまりとした、それでいてずっしりとしたこし餡のおはぎが５つ。
TextENG: Opening up the newspaper wrapping, there were five plump red bean paste mochi fit snugly inside.

TextJPN: 新聞紙には左端のものから順にＡ、Ｂ、Ｃ…とアルファベットが書きこまれている。
TextENG: There were letters written from left to right on the newspaper: A, B, C, D, and E.

TextJPN: さて。@kこの中のひとつがレナの手作りだと言うが……どれだろう？
TextENG: Now, then...@k They said Rena made one of these... I wonder which one.

TextJPN: 見た目はどれも大差ない。
TextENG: There wasn't much difference in how they looked.

TextJPN: 匂いも雰囲気もほとんど同じだ。@k……これは…手応え十分な問題だぞ？！
TextENG: They smelled and appeared about the same.@k ...This was... a pretty difficult problem!

TextJPN: 一番差が出るとしたら…おそらく形だろう。
TextENG: The biggest difference... was probably their shape.

TextJPN: 魅音のおばあちゃんがどんな人なのかはわからないが、レナのそれとは絶対に違うはず…！
TextENG: I wasn't sure what kind of person Mion's grandma was, but Rena's had to be different from hers...!

TextJPN: よく見ると中にひとつだけ、とても丁寧につくったおはぎがあった。
TextENG: Looking carefully, I could see one mochi that was made very neatly.

TextJPN: じっと見ればすぐわかるくらいに。
TextENG: So well that, just by staring at it, one could tell it stood out.

TextJPN: 「……この１個がレナのか否かが、勝負の分れ目みたいだな」
TextENG: ``...Looks like this challenge depends on whether or not this one is Rena's.``

TextJPN: さらに頭を落ち着けて良く考える…！
TextENG: Calm down and think even harder...!

TextJPN: …このおはぎ、魅音は確か、おばあちゃんが山ほど作ったのでお裾分けって言ったよな。
TextENG: ...Mion had said her grandma made a ton of them and was told to give some out, if I remembered correctly.

TextJPN: …ってことはつまり、この中の４つはその山ほどの中の４つのわけだ。
TextENG: ...So that meant four of these were from that large batch.

TextJPN: 対してレナはどうか？
TextENG: Then what about Rena?

TextJPN: 多分…これ１個しか作ってないだろう。
TextENG: She probably... only made one.

TextJPN: だからその１個に手間を惜しまないに違いない。
TextENG: So she probably spent quite a bit of time on it.

TextJPN: ……つまり、…レナの手作りおはぎはこの…Ｅだ！！
TextENG: ...Meaning... the one Rena had made was this one... E!!

TextJPN: 一瞬、それを見越した魅音のワナではないかとも思ったが、それはないだろう。
TextENG: For a moment I thought it may have been a trap Mion laid as she knew I'd pick up on it, but that probably wasn't the case.

TextJPN: …魅音が作ったならいざ知れず、レナが作ったと言ったのだからそういう引っ掛けはないはずなのだ。
TextENG: ...I wouldn't be so sure if I knew Mion had made it, but since she said Rena made it, it probably wasn't a trap.

TextJPN: 「よし。@k@vS01/01/120100349.お茶も準備ＯＫ。@k@vS01/01/120100350.まずはディフェンディングチャンピオンの魅音のばあちゃんからだ。@k@vS01/01/120100351.……どれ」
TextENG: ``All right.@k@vS01/01/120100349. My tea is ready, too.@k@vS01/01/120100350. I'll start with the defending champ, Mion's grandma.@k@vS01/01/120100351. ...Let's see.``

TextJPN: ふむ。@k…悪くない。
TextENG: Hmm.@k ...Not bad.

TextJPN: こし餡の滑らかさと十分な食べ応えの両立は侮り難し！！
TextENG: The smooth bean paste and soft, chewy texture left little to be desired!

TextJPN: その後にすするお茶も引きたてている。@k…これは…素晴らしい仕事だぞ！
TextENG: The tea I drank afterwards also accentuated the experience.@k ...This... was an exquisite piece of work!

TextJPN: さて、レナの方はどうかな？
TextENG: Now, how about Rena's?

TextJPN: 高級和菓子を思わせる繊細な作り。
TextENG: The creation was so delicate, one would think it was a high-class Japanese dessert.

TextJPN: 食べ盛りの俺としてはボリュームに若干の不安を感じるが…。@kまずは一口…。
TextENG: Since I normally had quite the appetite, I was slightly worried about the size of the portion...@k But, well... first, a bite...

TextJPN: ……これは…難しいジャッジになりそうだぞ？！
TextENG: ...This was quite a difficult one to judge, actually!

TextJPN: 使っている材料はまったく同じなのだから味に大差はない。
TextENG: The ingredients were exactly the same so there was little difference in flavor.

TextJPN: 違うのは最後の握りの部分だけなんだから、そりゃそうだ。
TextENG: What was different was how it was shaped at the end, so it was to be expected.

TextJPN: となると勝負は芸術点と…ボリュームが分ける事になるだろう。
TextENG: So the deciding factors would be... presentation and volume.

TextJPN: しっかりとした食べ応えのチャンピオンに、食べ飽きない大きさのチャレンジャーレナ！
TextENG: The well-formed and well-sized champion, versus Rena the challenger, with a size you just couldn't get enough of!

TextJPN: まだレナのは一口しか食べていない。
TextENG: I'd only had one bite of Rena's.

TextJPN: とりあえず食べ終わってからのジャッジにすべきだろう。
TextENG: I would probably have to wait until after I was done eating to make my decision.

TextJPN: ……ひょっとすると…何か逆転になるようなすごい仕掛けが隠されているかもしれないんだからな…！
TextENG: ...Maybe... there was something hidden inside that could cause an upset...!
``*chew chew* ...Hmm...``

TextJPN: 俺の予想は的中したようだ。
TextENG: It seems my prediction was right.

TextJPN: 俺の舌が何かに触る。
TextENG: My tongue touched something.

TextJPN: 食べるものとは少し違うようだったので、とりあえずそれを指につまんで取り出してみた。
TextENG: It didn't feel like something edible, so I reached in with my fingers and grabbed it.
...What...@k@|@y ...What was this?

TextJPN: それが何かを頭が理解する前に、俺は食べかけのおはぎごと、それを力いっぱい投げ付けた！！！
TextENG: Before I could fully comprehend what it was, I threw away the rest of the mochi I was eating as fast as I could!

TextJPN: 壁に叩きつけられ、餡が飛び散る。
TextENG: It slammed against the wall, causing the bean jam to splatter.

TextJPN: そして、一心拍置いてからぼろりと剥がれ落ちて床に落ちた。
TextENG: Then, after sticking for a moment, it slid down to the floor.

TextJPN: …呆然とする俺自身。
TextENG: ...I was dumbstruck by my own actions.

TextJPN: 何やってるんだ、俺は…？！
TextENG: What was I doing...!?

TextJPN: せっかくのレナの手作りに…何て事をッ？！
TextENG: Rena had gone out of her way to make it for me... How could I!?

TextJPN: 呆然と、凶行に及んだ俺の手を見、そして…口の中から取り出したそれが何だったのかを思い出す……。
TextENG: Dumbstruck, I looked down at the hand that performed such a vile act... then I remembered what I had taken out of my mouth...

TextJPN: それは初め、髪の毛かと思った。
TextENG: At first I thought it was a hair.

TextJPN: だけど、魅音より短いレナにしたって髪の長さは結構ある。@kあんなに短くはないはずだ。
TextENG: Even though it was shorter than Mion's, Rena's hair was still quite long.@k And it wasn't this short.

TextJPN: それに、髪の毛というにはちょっと硬かった。
TextENG: It was also a bit too hard to be hair.

TextJPN: 舌の上でちょっと転がすだけの太さもあった。
TextENG: It was thick enough to roll around on my tongue.

TextJPN: …ちょっと銀の輝きがあり、…一方の端には、そう、裁縫針のような、糸を通すような穴が空いていて……。
TextENG: ...There was a bit of a metallic sheen on one end of it, ah yes, there was a hole for where thread goes through, like it was a sewing needle...

TextJPN: うん、そうだ…。
TextENG: Yes, that's right...

TextJPN: 裁縫針によく似ていた。
TextENG: It looked very much like a sewing needle...

TextJPN: …そっくりだった。
TextENG: ...Exactly like one.

TextJPN: …先端も尖っていた。@kかなり鋭く。
TextENG: ...The end was pointed as well.@k Quite sharply.

TextJPN: …本当に裁縫針にそっくりだった。
TextENG: ...It really did look just like a sewing needle.

TextJPN: あれ？
TextENG: Huh?

TextJPN: …さっきのあれは……“裁縫針によく似た”、何だったんだ……？
TextENG: ...What did I mean by, ``looked very much like a sewing needle,`` just a bit ago...?

TextJPN: …………答えなんか出ない。
TextENG: ...I couldn't answer.

TextJPN: だが、俺の中にいるもうひとりの俺にはわかったらしく、…それを奥歯をがちがちと鳴らせて教えてくれた。
TextENG: But a voice inside me already knew... and let me know by chattering my molars together.

TextJPN: …湧き上がってくる恐怖を打ち消せない…。
TextENG: ...I couldn't stave off the terror welling up inside me...

TextJPN: 急に鉄の味がし、舌の奥がぴりぴりと痛くなる。
TextENG: Suddenly, I tasted something metallic and felt a prickling pain at the back of my throat.

TextJPN: …出血を確かめるため、指を口の奥へ突っ込み、ぺたぺたと触ってみた。
TextENG: ...I stuck my finger in the back of my mouth and felt around to see if I was bleeding.

TextJPN: ……突如こみ上げて来る嘔吐感。
TextENG: ...Suddenly, I felt the urge to vomit.

TextJPN: ひりひりする味の胃液が喉の奥を刺激する。
TextENG: The sharp taste of bile irritated the back of my throat.

TextJPN: 両の手で喉をぐっと押さえ、しばし悶え苦しむと…嘔吐感はなんとか収まった。
TextENG: I clasped both hands over my mouth and, after writhing in agony... I was somehow able to hold back the nausea.

TextJPN: ようやく正常に息ができるようになると、今度は心臓が早鐘のようにばくばく言い始める。
TextENG: I was finally able to breath normally again, but this time my heart was throbbing intensely.

TextJPN: ………そして、ようやくこっち側の俺も理解する。@kおはぎに何が混じっていたのかを。
TextENG: ...Then, it finally registered...@k ...Exactly what was mixed in with the mochi.

TextJPN: その単語を脳裏に浮かべるより手が動く方が早かった。
TextENG: Before I could think of the correct word, my hands were already on the move.

TextJPN: どしゃッ！
TextENG: *Splat*

TextJPN: びたッ！！
TextENG: *Plop*

TextJPN: べしゃッ！！！
TextENG: *Splort*

TextJPN: 俺は残ったおはぎを次々と壁へ叩き付けた。
TextENG: I tossed the rest of the mochi against the wall.

TextJPN: 飛び散った餡の描く幾何学的模様がどこか不吉なものを想像させる…。
TextENG: The geometrical patterns of the scattered bean jam on the wall suddenly invoked a terrible omen in my mind...

TextJPN: それから目を背けると、俺は廊下に飛び出し、階段をどかどかと駆け上がり自室へ、朝のままになっている布団の中へ飛び込んだ。
TextENG: After looking away, I dashed out to the hall and flew upstairs to my room, where I stayed under my covers until morning.

TextJPN: そして自らの肩を抱き、恐怖と悔しさと怒りと悲しみでぐちゃぐちゃになりながら吠え猛った…。
TextENG: I clutched my own shoulders, howling madly in a mix of fear, anger, sadness and frustration...

TextJPN: これは脅しとか脅迫とか釘を刺すとかそんな生易しいものじゃなくて……ッ！！！
TextENG: This wasn't a threat or warning or reminder, nothing as simple as that...!!!

TextJPN: 雛見沢で何が起こってきたのか。
TextENG: What had happened in Hinamizawa?

TextJPN: 何が起こっているのか。
TextENG: What is happening in Hinamizawa?

TextJPN: 何が起ころうとしているのか。
TextENG: What would happen?

TextJPN: …そんなのはどれもわからないし、大事なことでもなかった。
TextENG: ...I didn't know the answer to any of those questions.

TextJPN: 一体、どこで禁忌に触れてしまったのか？！
TextENG: Where did I break a taboo!?

TextJPN: とにかく俺は…レナや魅音や…あるいは他にも？@k　敵を作ってしまっている！！
TextENG: Regardless... now Rena and Mion... and others...@k They consider me an enemy!

TextJPN: そしてそいつらは…俺なんか死んでしまえと思っている！！！
TextENG: And they thought... I should just die!!!

TextJPN: 殺されてたまるかよ！！@k　こんな、…わけもわからずに！！！
TextENG: I won't let you kill me!@k Not for such a... pointless reason!!!

TextJPN: 様々な負の感情はまるで渦巻く底無し沼のように、俺を安らかでない眠りへと引きずりこんで行った………。
TextENG: I fell into a restless sleep as I was crushed by my negative emotions. It was as if I was being drawn into a billowing, bottomless swamp...
